  }} }} 'Nickel carbonyl' (IUPAC name: 'tetracarbonylnickel') is the
  organonickel compound with the formula Ni(CO) 4. This pale-yellow
  liquid is the principal carbonyl of nickel. It is an intermediate in the Mond
  process for the purification of nickel and a reagent in organometallic
  chemistry. Nickel carbonyl is one of the most toxic substances encountered in
  industrial processes.
